result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy A. Hach

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: This case dismissed and read in as part of the agreement/resolution this date in 15CF86.  Minutes taken in that matter.
Status conference on November 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Troy A. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF86 and 15CM158 called together for status.  DA states that the parties are close to a resolution; asks for reset.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

15CF86 and 15CM158.  Defendant Troy A. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement; def plans to enter plea; counsel asking for PSI prior to sentencing.  Court questions PSI request.  Counsel ask that these matters be continued over to another day for plea and possible sentencing.  9/14 at 2:30.  

Atty. McDougal FILES THE PLEA AGREEMENT; ASKS COURT TO ENTER IT AND HOLD IT TIL 9/14.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Troy A. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF86/adjourned initial and 15CM158/status called together.  Counsel request adjournment of these matters.  Court sets 7/13 at 3:30.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Troy A. Hach. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states def is in custody in another jurisdiction; requests setover.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Troy A. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 15CF86/adjourned initial and 15CM158/status.  Counsel request that these matters be rescheduled to 4/13.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 02-17-2016 02:30 pm

15CF86/adjourned initial and 15Cm158/status.  Defendant Troy A. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Further "status" requested and set for 2/17 at 2:30.  Def continues to waive prelim time limits in 15CF86; that matter to be set for AIA; other for status.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Troy A. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M.   Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Adj. initial moved from 9/15 to 9/22 - request of SPD office on behalf of Atty. McDougal who has been assigned to this case

Court reads the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel.  Def wants time to consider matter of counsel; has been instructed to contact SPD for elig. determination.  Matter adj. to 9/15 at 9.
